attributes.action: Ban imports of Russian oil and gas from the UK…
attributes.background: UK Gov should ban imports of all Russian Oil and Gas products immediately
attributes.additional_details: We cannot in good conscience continue to pay Russia for energy when we know it will use this revenue to perpetrate warfare on Ukraine

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Place the strictest possible sanctions on Russia until it withdraws from Ukraine: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609428

Full embargo of Russian imports in lieu of active military support in Ukraine: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609457

attributes.action: The Government should let customers opt out of the £200 energy bill loan.
attributes.background:
I would like the UK Government to reconsider the £200 energy loan that they are proposing in regards of the rising energy costs.

I would like the Government to let individual customers to be able to make their own decision whether they ant to opt in or decline the offer.
attributes.additional_details: Forcing customers into personal debt without consent should never be allowed. This should be an individual decision and an option to opt out should be allowed.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608007

attributes.action: Order the energy companies to foot the energy price hike not the consumer
attributes.background: As we watch the price of living increase all around us through national insurance contributions, student loan repayments, fuel prices, interest rates, food and petrol/diesels prices we are hit with a 54% increase to the energy price cap due to rise in April with a subsequent rise to standing charges
attributes.additional_details: We have seen no increase to our incomings but our outgoings are set to soar by April. During this time the ‘big 6’ energy suppliers in the UK have seen more than 1 BILLION pounds in profit ahead of this price increase. With SSE being the biggest earner taking in £600 MILLION in profit before tax according to Ofgem. We call upon the government to follow the path of the French Government and protect citizens who are already struggling with the cost of living!

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

Decisions on what price to charge customers for energy are a matter for energy suppliers, not the Government or Parliament. 

You might like to sign the following petition:

Tax 50% of the Energy Companies profits to help households pay bills.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607983  

Alternatively, you could start a new petition calling for a different level of tax on energy companies to fund compensatory payments to energy customers, if that's something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: It should not be mandatory to take a £200 loan for energy
attributes.background: The government should give us a choice to decline this loan.  Many people do not like to be in debt and this is a debt which is not of their choosing.
attributes.additional_details: It is forcing people to accept a loan whether they want or need it or not.  It should b3 a choice.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608007

attributes.action: Decrease pension age for those who cared for their children.
attributes.background: A reduced retirement age to 60 yrs for women/men and single parents who have compromised their careers to care for their children .
attributes.additional_details: Those who have worked full-time and been able to develop their careers, mainly men, are able to retire much earlier. Child carers mostly have worked part-time in low paid jobs to fit around their children. This results in them relying on the State Pension,  waiting longer to retire with reduced energy levels and physical and mental decline. It's frightening how young people will not be able to retire until the age of 75yrs, if at all.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

We understand you want to see a reduced pension age for people who have spent part of their working life caring for their children. However, it's not clear exactly who you would like this to apply to - for example, whether this would be limited to individuals who have received carer's allowance or other benefits to support them in caring for a child with care needs, or whether you would like this to be available to anyone who has taken time out of employment to help raise a child.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Re open all Coalfired Power stations to protect the Nation from energy poverty.
attributes.background: In April we will all be faced with out of control energy bills which will impact our personal lives and our ability to compete in World markets. Our security will also be at the mercy of foreign imports of energy. In April we will also see increases in NI and Council Tax and reductions in Pensions
attributes.additional_details: The future we are being pushed into will finally break the Political system of Government. It will demonstrate that Government does not run the Country for the benefit of the People but just the few who continue to depress our great Country and bring hardship to more and more of all of us, the long suffering masses.

rejection.details:
Decisions on whether to seek to re-open closed energy generating facilities, such as coal fired power stations, are matters for the owners and operators of such facilities, not the UK Government or Parliament. The responsibility for balancing the UK's electricity supply sits with the National Grid Electricity System Operator (ESO), and it has the power to instruct certain facilities to be turned on when needed. This means the UK Government is not directly responsible for the action this petition calls for.

You could have a petition calling on the Government to make coal a central feature of its energy policy, and increase funding to the sector, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: All new buildings and home’s should be built with solar tiles on the roof
attributes.background: Change the building regulations.
attributes.additional_details: The technology is available to build houses with this type of tile. It seems like a great step towards more energy efficient buildings. With every roof that’s built, more electricity will be produced and more fossil fuels will be saved. The UK will be a little bit greener.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584316

attributes.action: Accelerate Clean Energy, using Solar to encourage Virtual Power Plants
attributes.background: Mandate from 1st February all new buildings must be fitted with Solar Tiles or Panels covering an area no less than 80% of the roof. From the 1st February 2030 all buildings having roof repairs which exceed 30% of area must have Solar Tiles or Panel covering an area no less than 80% of roof area.
attributes.additional_details: All Solar deployments must participate in a Virtual Power Plant so that they can be used to stabilise the Grid, provide power at night and help charge electric vehicles. Building regulations must be updated. Local energy companies must provide the necessary connectivity within 90 days of application. Protection must be offered to ensure Solar energy can be collected.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584316

It's not clear what you mean by a "virtual power plant", especially as your petition refers to this providing power at night, when solar panels would not be generating energy.

attributes.action: Make any referendum relating to the union require the consent of Westminster
attributes.background: The Scotland act (1998) clearly classifies the Union as a reserved matter (something only Westminster can legislate on), but there is confusion around if this includes referendums on the union. To clear up any confusion it should be made explicitly clear that referendums need Westminster’s consent.
attributes.additional_details: To avoid a ‘Catalonia’ like situation in the United Kingdom, which threatens both the stability of our country and the economy of its members, it should be made clear that Westminster is authority that must approve referendums which relate to the union. No government should waste time or energy on a ‘wildcat referendum’ which would only cause confusion, waste tax payers money and create discourse amongst our citizens.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577829

attributes.action: fixed rate for companies wether post payment or prepayment
attributes.background: I would like a fixed rate for energy providers whether it be pre-payment or post payment.
attributes.additional_details:
I would like a fixed rate for energy providers whether it be pre-payment or post payment. 
It is absolutely ridiculous that the people who are worse off have to prepay for their energy and they  suffer because they are charged higher rates, which will never be equal or ever help them to get out of the deficit that they’re in. It doesn’t make sense that whether you’re on a prepayment or post payment meter and use the same electricity that the amount is different because you pay for it before you use it or you pay for it after you use it. It’s disgusting that people who are unable to get credit or gain a post payment meter have to suffer with higher payments or charges because they are in an awful predicament.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317925

attributes.action: Make a compulsory 'mental health day' once a month for students
attributes.background: Students mental health does not seem to matter as much as their schoolwork. Therefore they should be able to choose one day a month not to come in and marked down as a 'mental health day'.
attributes.additional_details: I am a student myself and therefore know that we have days that we will plead not to come to school but ,as usual, we are made to. This effects us in many ways as we do not focus on work on that day and do not have the energy to do anything. Thank you for your time and I hope you consider this

rejection.details:
Students can already not attend school for medical grounds, which would include reasons related to mental health.

If you want students to be able to take one day off a month for their personal wellbeing, rather than because of any specific mental health issues, we could accept a petition calling for this, but it would need to be clear that this is what you want to happen.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Make mental health and wellbeing checks compulsory in all levels of education: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331616

Fund free Mental Health First Aider training for 1 adult in every school: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/548425

Require all schools to offer regular counselling to students: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328361

attributes.action: Due to the stress of Covid-19 all gcse/A-level students should pass their exams.
attributes.background: Pass all the gcse/A level student as this would not only take of the stress but also improve there mental health.Due to Covid  many students have gone into depression and if in any case they do fail there exams this can lead to many students committing suicide.
attributes.additional_details:
Seven in ten 18-24-year-olds feel anxious about finding employment post-graduation and their ability to earn money in the near future due to the COVID-19 epidemic. 
Mental health problems can affect a student's energy level, concentration, dependability, mental ability, and optimism, hindering performance. Research suggests that depression is associated with lower grade point averages, and that co-occurring depression and anxiety can increase the chance of them developing suicidal thoughts.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards, individual schools and Ofqual, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773

attributes.action: Introduce Carbon Tax to pay for Covid19 and transform to a green economy.
attributes.background: A Carbon Tax applied to products & services that release carbon dioxide in their production, use, or disposal. Things that might be low in Carbon Tax would be electric cars or local grown fruit & veg. Gas guzzling cars or processed meat products with plastic packaging would cost a little more.
attributes.additional_details:
The money generated from Carbon Tax would pay the COVID 19 debt mountain and transform to a green economy, revenue to be split 50/50. 

Measures implemented might be to encourage more home working to reduce commuting, which produces Carbon Dioxide, give everyone a free bike to encourage more cycling, give every house with a roof free solar panels and battery storage.  

A refurbishments & building programme of energy-efficient homes and infrastructure could be used to kick start the economy.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321854

attributes.action: Rescue the Economy by creating Green Jobs and scrapping investment in Fossil
attributes.background:
The government should stimulate the economy and halt the destruction of our ecosystem by creating millions of jobs in clean energy and putting carbon emissions into structural decline.

The world only has 6 months left to change the course of the climate crisis, according to the IEA.
attributes.additional_details:
Covid-19 has seen millions thrown into unemployment and at this critical point for the survival of life on earth, we must not look backwards by funding the industries that are destroying it.

The IEA has also stated that targeting green jobs will be more effective than pouring money into the high-carbon economy. Their sustainably recovery plan sets out the potential of 1.9m jobs in building efficiency, 1.1m in wind and solar power, 0.86m in power networks and millions more in other areas.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

attributes.action: Use the current situation as a basis to reduce climate change and global warming
attributes.background: To use this opportunity as a basis for continued reductions in GHGs, by continuing to lower their reliance on fossil fuels, after this pandemic. Further they should increase the ability to work from home, free access to Internet, renewable energy, reduce meat production and dependence.
attributes.additional_details: We have seen unprecedented improvements to our seas and cities since this lockdown. Venice is crystal clear, the sky's are bluer, and animals have taken over the parks. This shows us how much the world can improve in such a short time and we should not erase this progress and "return to normal" we need a new normal that fully addresses the growing issues of global warming, climate change and continued environmental degradation.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition instead: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

attributes.action: Use Predicted Grades to Determine the Future of Year 10’s
attributes.background: We want predicted grades to determine the future of next years Year 11’s (current Year 10’s). This will put students minds at ease and they can then work stress free. The work done in lockdown wouldn’t go to waste and go towards a final predicted grade at the end of next year.
attributes.additional_details: This is the best scenario possible as it gives teachers a chance to restart when students and staff return to school (which could still be a long time in the future) and it gives Year 10 students clarity and a fresh burst of energy to get the best grade possible ready for the world of work-who are desperately waiting for new employees.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament.

Work with regulators and exam providers to clarify exam arrangements for 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312570

attributes.action: Turn off all the lights and screens in the cities during covid19 lockdown!
attributes.background:
All the city lights and screens should be turned off to save energy during the lockdown... People aren't out to see them. 
Just keep the streetlights on.
attributes.additional_details:
I've seen all over the news, millions of lights still remaining on and huge screens in the cities all over the world. 
Imagine how much energy we could save, help heal our world in these times.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for most public and private lighting. These are a matter for individual local authorities and businesses.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to Require businesses to turn off lighting in empty offices during Covid-19, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310317

You could start a new petition calling on the Governemnt to require local authorities and private businesses to turn off all non-essential lighting and screens, if that is what you would like to happen. You would need to provide your full name in order for us to be able to accept your petition.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

attributes.action: Temporarily enforce a reduction on energy prices
attributes.background: During the COVID19 pandemic, energy companies should be forced to either reduce people’s bills. This is given to the fact that the majority of the population (except key workers) are having to self-isolate at home, meaning that they are using more energy than usual.
attributes.additional_details: With the COVID19 pandemic in effect, along with the Government enforced self-isolation, the majority of the population are having to stay at home. Whereby they are more than likely to be using more energy than usual. Especially with so many people being affected by COVID19, insomuch as losing their jobs and other industries (eg mortgages) offering some kind of support to people. It would make financial sense to individuals, for energy companies to introduce temporary reductions in their prices/bills.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312363

attributes.action: Declare a national holiday on the day after Coronavirus lockdown is over
attributes.background:
Lockdown specifically refers to any restrictions placed on daily life as a result of the Covid-19 outbreak. 
This petition asks that the day after these restrictions are lifted should be a national holiday. 
This should include all the normal parameters of a bank holiday.
attributes.additional_details:
There are 2 main reasons:
Celebration
Rejuvenation
The limitations of self isolation and social distancing are an affront to many since they cannot enjoy that basic aspect of life. The holiday would allow people to go out and meet friends and family for the first time in weeks, a joyous moment for many. Permitting things like parties and meetings would give people the chance to improve their mood and to reintegrate into daily life.
Secondly, rejuvenation which simply allows people to re consolidate energy after a long period of isolation; preparing them for work and going back to normal life.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304513

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

attributes.action: Create a national pool of essential delivery service drivers for the pandemic
attributes.background: Instruct heads of essential and non-essential commercial services to coordinate between themselves to restrict non essential delivery services and release the extra manpower that is generated from the non-essential service reatrictions for rapid training in the delivery of essential services.
attributes.additional_details: To maintain adequate supply infrastructures for delivery of essential goods and services. Energy (petroleums) Food and Pharmacy / Medical supplies.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. 

You could start a petition calling for the Government to create a national fleet of delivery drivers to be funded by the state, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Force energy companies to reduce unit cost when self-isolation becomes necessary
attributes.background:
It is just a matter of time until the Government make self-isolation a legal requirement. This will lead families ot using more energy.
Everyone is sacrificing, so energy companies need to step up and support.
attributes.additional_details:
With the advent of Coronavirus, it is inevitable that large portions of the population will be required to self-isolate to try and slow down the spread of it.
When schools close, this will mean parents will need to stay home with their children. 
With so many people staying at home, their use of energy to heat and power their confinement will increase.
Energy companies need to step up to the plate and support the population by reducing the cose of electricity and gas/oil for the duration

rejection.details:
Suspending payments for rent, council tax, mortgages and utilities is a matter for individual landlords, councils, mortgage providers and utility providers, and not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you want the Government to encourage lenders, landlords and utilities to freeze payments during lockdown, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302256

If you want the Government to require councils to suspend council tax payments during the coronavirus outbreak, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303274

If you want the Government to implement Universal Basic Income to give home and food security during the coronavirus outbreak, you may also wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302284

You can find out  about asking for a mortgage holiday from lenders here: https://www.fca.org.uk/consumers/mortgages-coronavirus-consumers

You can find out about what Government support is available for people as a result of coronavirus (under the section on employment and financial support) here: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

Read letters asking further questions of Government Ministers: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/

attributes.action: Address the climate emergency with the same urgency as the corona virus
attributes.background: The coronavirus has shown that the world can respond to a global emergency with decisive action. Government should respond effectively to the economic impacts of the coronavirus and the climate emergency at the same time, through large-scale green investment and a rapid shift to a green economy.
attributes.additional_details: The UK as chair of the next UN climate summit is in a pivotal position to bring the world to effective action and must lead by example. The coronavirus crisis provides a unique opportunity for large-scale investment in green energy, housing, transport, technology, education and nature restoration, and for a shift of focus from unsustainable growth to broader wellbeing. Responses to the coronavirus should not prop up high-carbon industries but support a just transition towards a green economy.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to take action to address climate change, but it's not clear what you want the Government to do to achieve this.

You could start a new petition which states more clearly what you want the Government to do to address climate change.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to protect the Environment and support carbon neutral energy alternatives, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300000

We have also published a petition calling on the Government to publish new carbon budgets linked to the Paris Agreement and Climate Change Act, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300178

attributes.action: Covid-19 Emergency: Pause Brexit to Protect Britain
attributes.background:
Covid-19 is an unprecedented threat to the lives of UK citizens and the UK economy. Beating it will require the PM and government's undivided attention. We cannot afford distractions. Lives are at stake.

We, the undersigned, therefore call on the government to pause Brexit immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
Pausing Brexit negotiations & preparations will:

- enable the government to focus all of its time, energy and resources on coordinating a response to the deadly Covid-19 pandemic

- ensure the UK remains part of the European Medicines Agency so that we can work effectively with our European partners and gain prompt access to the Covid-19 vaccine

Beating Covid-19 must be our top priority. Please pause Brexit now. Focus all of our resources on protecting Britain. Lives depend on it.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300412

attributes.action: Form national team of food retailers supporting FSM in school CV19 closure
attributes.background: Schools will close given the significant challenges with students and staff struck by CV19. Our most vulnerable in most deprived communities will be decimated unless we safeguard their daily subsistence with access  to a range of outlets providing some form of voucher based support to be fed daily.
attributes.additional_details: Get all major retailers to agree on basis meal deal provision with variety of cost effective sandwiches, fruit or basic heatable meals to ensure the most vulnerable have the energy and strength to remain fit & strong in the fight if their lives. Schools individually ate not equipped to do this on their own. This is a national challenge and can present as one of the greatest signs of developing community and ensuring all FSM, in all schools and regions are adequately supported. Anything less? No.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced the closure of schools and colleges, and has said that, to support children eligible for free school meals, schools will be able to provide meals or vouchers for supermarkets or local shops: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/schools-colleges-and-early-years-settings-to-close

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public

attributes.action: Everyone should share the cost of the corona virus COVID-19 period
attributes.background: No-one should be paid for the duration; politicians, banks, employees, directors, energy companies, banks, doctors, self employed, benefits, hotels, investors, teachers, mechanics etc etc etc. That way everyone pays for the cost of corona virus and everyone is equally committed to eliminating it.
attributes.additional_details: If the government suspends normal life to control the corona virus spread, the cost of this decision must be shared by everyone. Not just more credit given or payment holidays. The impact on certain sections of the population of not being able to operate will be massive and very potentially irrecoverable. By taking this action we will reduce business failures and encourage the compliance of everyone with the requirements, so we can all get back to work when it is over.

rejection.details:
The payment of most individuals is a matter for individual companies and employers, not the Government or Parliament.

You can find out about what Government support is available for people as a result of coronavirus (under the section on employment and financial support) here: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

attributes.action: Close Cumbrian Coal Mine ! Instead of going backwards we should move forward !
attributes.background: The Government has decided short term thinking is the best strategy to combat the energy crisis. Being dependent on other countries is of no means a good position to be in but, as a country of influence, by opening this mine, we are indirectly stating “climate change is no threat”.
attributes.additional_details:
It’s important to plant seeds for trees of shadows we will never sit in. The desperate decision to open this coal mine is the same short term thinking we had in the early 2000s when we didn’t invest in our own energy resulting in a massive energy crisis now, because we are dependent on other countries.

I understand that there will be a reason why the government has done this, but I think fundamentally as a country we should take the harder route if it means standing up to climate change.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/629570

attributes.action: Create a new energy market for renewables that is not linked to gas prices.
attributes.background: The energy market needs an overhaul. Renewables and gas pricing should be decoupled from one another. Energy produced by renewables should have its own marketplace and it needs to be done sooner than later.
attributes.additional_details: The energy price hikes prove that the energy market is broken, out of date, and not fit for purpose. When we choose to have our electricity supplied from a renewable source we should not be paying inflated prices due to it being linked to the price of gas.The government needs to intervene in creating a new renewables only market. This will provide much cheaper electricity prices for consumers, enabling more people to reduce their reliance on gas. It's a win for consumers and the environment.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621874

attributes.action: We demand the UK stops the extraction of oil in UK territories
attributes.background: We demand that the UK government stops extraction of oil in return for renewable energy sources. New oil licences and oil exploration must be halted and current oil drilling phased out.
attributes.additional_details: The burning of fossil fuels, in particular oil, contributes hugely to climate change. As a developed country the UK has a responsibility to follow the examples of other countries and stop oil extraction. Even if it brings the UK money now, new oil licences will hugely contribute to climate change and will result in the need for much heavier spending further down the line, in order to prevent catastrophic consequences.
